                                  java.lang.Object target)
Copies all common properties of an object to another.

Parameters:
source - Object who's properties will be copied to the target object.
target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
See Also:
copyProperties(Object, Object, String[])

copyProperties

public static void copyProperties(java.lang.Object source,
                                  java.lang.Object target,
                                  java.lang.String[] properties)
Copies common properties of an object to another. The method will copy all properties of the source object that have their name included in the properties array, to the target object. The property will be copied only if it has the same type in both objects or if the type of the first object's property is assignable to the type of the second object's property. Source and target object don't need to be instances of the same class. If either the source or the target objects are null the method will have no effect on either object.

Parameters:
source - Object who's properties will be copied to the target object.
target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
properties - Names of properties to copy. If this array is empty or null then all properties of source will be copied to the target.

copyPropertiesWithDefaults

public static void copyPropertiesWithDefaults(java.lang.Object source,
                                              java.lang.Object target,
                                              java.lang.String[] properties)
Copies common properties of an object to another.
The method will copy all properties of the source object that have their name included in the properties array, to the target object. The property will be copied only if it has the same type in both objects or if the type of the first object's property is assignable to the type of the second object's property. Source and target object don't need to be instances of the same class.
If the value of a property is null, then the default value defined for the property type is set. The default values are specified and retrieved from the Defaults utility class.
If either the source or the target objects are null the method will have no effect on either object.

Parameters:
source - Object who's properties will be copied to the target object.
target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
properties - Names of properties to copy. If this array is empty or null then all properties of source will be copied to the target.

copyPropertiesExcluding

public static void copyPropertiesExcluding(java.lang.Object source,
                                           java.lang.Object target,
                                           java.lang.String[] excluded)
Copies all common properties of an object to another excluding some properties.

Parameters:
source - Object who's properties will be copied to the target object.
target - Object to which the properties will be copied.
excluded - List of properties to exclude.
See Also:
copyProperties(Object, Object, String[])

getMethodByUniqueName

public static java.lang.reflect.Method getMethodByUniqueName(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                             java.lang.Class<?> type)
Gets the method of the specified class with the specified name. Public and declared methods of the specified type are included. The specified method name must be unique in the specified type, otherwise a runtime exception is thrown.

Parameters:
methodName - Method name.
type - Type on which the method is searched.
Returns:
Returns the method that matches the search criteria. If there is no method matching the search criteria, returns null.

                                                                   boolean excludeStatic)

Parameters:
methodName - Method name.
type - Type on which the method is searched.
excludeStatic - If true, then static methods are not included
Returns:
Returns the method that matches the search criteria. If there is no method matching the search criteria, returns null.

getMethodsByUniqueName

public static java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Method> getMethodsByUniqueName(java.lang.String methodName,
                                                                              java.lang.Class<?> type)
Gets the method of the specified class with the specified name. Public and declared methods of the specified type are included. The specified method name must be unique in the specified type, otherwise a runtime exception is thrown. Tweaked this so that it returns inherited protected and default access methods. From these only the closest method to the inspected type is added.

Parameters:
methodName - Method name.
type - Type on which the method is searched.
Returns:
Returns the method that matches the search criteria. If there is no method matching the search criteria, returns null.

isDefaultAccess

public static boolean isDefaultAccess(int mod)
Parameters:
mod -
Returns:
Returns true, if the access modifier is default.

invokeMethodByUniqueName

public static <T> T invokeMethodByUniqueName(java.lang.Object owner,
                                             java.lang.String methodName,
                                             java.lang.Object... args)
Invokes a method on an object given the unique name of the method and an argument list. When finding the method, all declared methods of the object class are considered. NOTE: In case of overloaded methods that have declared parameter types lists for which the parameter types are assignable to each other on-by-one this will invoke the first method matched.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of the return type.
Parameters:
methodName - Name of the method.
owner - Runtime object to invoke the method on.
args - Varargs list of arguments for the method.
Returns:
Returns the method result, or null if it is void.

Returns:

getPublicMethodsOfType

public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] getPublicMethodsOfType(java.lang.Class<?> type)
Gets all public methods of a type. Normally type.getMethods() should do the job. But IBM JREs don't follow the standard. IBM JREs don't return two methods with the same signature that are defined in different interfaces, implemented by type. This method gets all methods.

Parameters:
type -
Returns:
Returns a list with all public

Returns:

getDeclaredMethods

public static java.lang.reflect.Method[] getDeclaredMethods(java.lang.String[] methodNames,
                                                            java.lang.Class<?> type)
Returns an array with all methods declared in the type that match one of the method names provided in the String[]. If the methodNames array is empty or null, then synthetic methods are ignored. Inherited methods are not included.

Parameters:
methodNames - methodNames to match
type - the type to inspect
Returns:
an array of methods of the type that match a methodName within methodNames

obj - Object on which the field is evaluated.
Returns:
Returns the value of the field on the specified object.

                                                   java.lang.Object obj)
Gets the values of a List of Fields from an Object.

Parameters:
fields -
obj -
Returns:
List with fields' values on the specified instance.

get

public static java.lang.Object get(java.lang.String fieldName,
                                   java.lang.Object obj)
Gets the value of a field on an object. The method searches for the field in all super classes of the object. Because of the way the allFields() method works, priority is given on fields that are declared as close as possible to the class of parameter obj. For example, if the superclass of obj's class declares a private field that has the same name with one of the fields declared in obj's class, this will not be accessed. Instead, the method will access the field declared directly in obj's class.

Parameters:
fieldName - Name of the field that will be evaluated on an object.
obj - Object on which the field is evaluated.
Returns:
Returns the value of the field on the specified object.

hasField

public static boolean hasField(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                               java.lang.String fieldName,
                               java.lang.Class<?> fieldType)
Indicates if the specified class has a field with the specified name and type.

Parameters:
type - Type checked for field excistence.
fieldName - Name of field
fieldType - Type of field.
Returns:
Returns true if the class has a field with this name and type.

set

public static void set(java.lang.reflect.Field field,
                       java.lang.Object val,
                       java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the value of a field on an object. The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
field - Field that will be set on an object.
val - New value for the field.
obj - Object on which the field value is changed.

set

public static void set(java.lang.String fieldName,
                       java.lang.Object val,
                       java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the value of a field on an object. The method searches for the field in all super classes of the object. Because of the way the allFields() method works, priority is given on fields that are declared as close as possible to the class of parameter obj. For example, if the superclass of obj's class declares a private field that has the same name with one of the fields declared in obj's class, this will not be accessed. Instead, the method will access the field declared directly in obj's class. The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
fieldName - Name of the field that will be set on an object.
val - New value for the field.
obj - Object on which the field value is changed.

setFirstFieldByDeclaredType

public static <T> void setFirstFieldByDeclaredType(java.lang.Class<T> declaredType,
                                                   T val,
                                                   java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the first field with the specified declared type of an object with a value.
This method should be use with caution in test classes only (for example to inject a dependency without hard-coding the field name, if it is known that there is only one field of the specified type on the class of the object we want to inject to).

Type Parameters:
T - Declared type of the field.
Parameters:
declaredType - Declared type of the field.
val - Value to set on the field.
obj - Object whose class has the field.

setProperty

public static void setProperty(java.lang.String property,
                               java.lang.Object val,
                               java.lang.Object obj)
Sets the value of a property on an object. If the property has a setter method, then it will be called. If the property does not have a setter method, the field will be set. If there is no such field, then the method will ignore it.
The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
property - Name of the property.
val - New value for the field.
obj - Object on which the field value is changed.

getProperty

public static java.lang.Object getProperty(java.lang.String property,
                                           java.lang.Object obj)
Gets the value of a property on an object. If the property has a getter method, then it will be called. If the property does not have a getter method, the field will be get. If there is no such field, then a RuntimeException with cause a NoSuchFieldException will be thrown.
The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
property - name of the property.
obj - Object on which the property is accessed.
Returns:
Returns the value of this property.

getProperties

public static java.util.Map<java.lang.String,java.lang.Object> getProperties(java.lang.Object obj)
Gets the values of a bean's properties in a map keyed with the property names. This method transforms a javabean to a map.

Parameters:
obj - Java bean to transform to map.
Returns:
Returns a map that has an entry for each property of the specified object.

getProperties

                                                                             java.lang.String... properties)
Gets the values of the specified bean's properties in a map keyed with the property names.

Parameters:
obj - Object to get the property values from.
properties - Names of the properties that will be put in the map.
Returns:
Returns a map that has an entry for each property of the specified object.

See Also:
getConstructor(Class, Class...)

getConstructor

public static <T> java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T> getConstructor(java.lang.Class<T> clazz,
                                                                  java.lang.Class<?>... args)
Gets the constructor of a class given an array of argument types. All caught exceptions are re-thrown as a RuntimeException. The constructor is found by checking all constructors of the class that have the same number of parameters as the length of the given array and the array element types are assignable from the constructor parameter types one-by-one. Use this with caution, as it is possible this check to be true for more than one constructors of a class.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
clazz -
args -
Returns:
a Constructor of the class.

getWrapperClass

public static java.lang.Class<?> getWrapperClass(java.lang.Class<?> primitive)
Gets the wrapper class of the specified primitive class.

Parameters:
primitive -
Returns:
Returns the wrapper class of the specified class. If the specified class is not primitive, returns the same class.

argumentsMatchParameterTypes

public static boolean argumentsMatchParameterTypes(java.lang.Class<?>[] paramTypes,
                                                   java.lang.Object... arguments)
Checks if a number of object arguments is a match for a given array of parameter types. This is achieved by asserting that the classes of the object arguments are assignable one-by-one to the classes defined as the parameter types.

Parameters:
paramTypes - Array of parameter types.
arguments - Objects that are used as arguments (ordered).
Returns:
true, if the object arguments can be assigned one-by-one to the defined parameter types.

argumentTypesMatchParameterTypes

public static boolean argumentTypesMatchParameterTypes(java.lang.Class<?>[] paramTypes,
                                                       java.lang.Class<?>... argTypes)
Checks if a number of argument types is a match for a given array of parameter types. This is achieved by asserting that the classes of the object arguments are assignable one-by-one to the classes defined as the parameter types. NOTE: A null argument type is assumed to always be a match for the corresponding parameter type, unless the parameter type is a primitive.

Parameters:
paramTypes - Array of parameter types.
argTypes - Argument types (ordered)
Returns:
true, if the object arguments can be assigned one-by-one to the defined parameter types.

getCopyConstructor

public static <T> java.lang.reflect.Constructor<T> getCopyConstructor(java.lang.Class<T> clazz)
Gets the copy constructor of a class, if this class has one. A copy constructor is a constructor that takes as argument an instance of the specified class and creates a new instance by copying the specified argument. According to Josh Bloch a copy-constructor is a better alternative to using clone().
This method returns the constructor that takes an instance of the specified class as argument. There is no guarantee that this constructor is actually a copy constructor, so this method should be used with caution.

Type Parameters:
T -
Parameters:
clazz -
Returns:
Returns the copy-constructor of the specified class, if the class has a copy-constructor. If the class does not have a copy-constructor, returns null.

getNoArgConstructor

Gets the no argument constructor of a class, if the class has one.

Type Parameters:

Parameters:
clazz -
Returns:
Returns the no argument constructor of the specified class, if the class has one. If the class does not have a default constructor, returns null.

isInstanceOf

public static boolean isInstanceOf(java.lang.Object object,
                                   java.lang.Class<?> clazz)
Shows if an object is instance of a class. The method uses runtime class information in order to find if the object belongs to the class. Therefore if the object is null, the method will return null.

Parameters:
object - Object checked for being instance of a class.
clazz - Class.
Returns:
Returns true if object is an instance of clazz.

invoke

public static java.lang.Object invoke(java.lang.reflect.Method method,
                                      java.lang.Object target,
                                      java.lang.Object... args)
Invokes a method on an object. The method will box any Exception thrown during java reflection calls inside a RuntimeException.

Parameters:
method - Method to invoke.
target - Object on which the method will be invoked.
args - Arguments for the method invocation. If the method does not have any arguments, then this parameter must be null.
Returns:
Returns the object that is returned by the method. If the method is void, then returns null.

getValuesOfFields

public static <T> java.util.List<T> getValuesOfFields(java.lang.Object target,
                                                      java.util.List<java.lang.reflect.Field> fields,
                                                      java.lang.Class<T> type,
                                                      boolean includeNulls)
Gets a list with the values of the specified fields in the specified object that belong to the specified type.

Type Parameters:
T - Type of object.
Parameters:
target - Target object.
fields - List of field objects.
type - Type of fields.
includeNulls - If true, then nulls will also be included in the list.
Returns:
Returns a list with the same size as the fields list. Each element of the returned list is the value of the associated field in the specified object. If a field has a value of null, or a value that is not assignable to the specified type, then the element in the returned list is null.

getTypeHierarchy

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getTypeHierarchy(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                                                  java.lang.Class<?> baseType)
Returns the type hierarchy of a class, up to a base type. First, all the super classes (up to and including the baseType, if applicable) are found. Then all the interfaces declared by these types are added to the results, starting from the closest super class. Each type is only included once, but the order in the list depends on the aforementioned procedure.

Parameters:
type -
baseType - Base type beyond which the hierarchy is not fetched. Each and every one of the returned types must be a sub-type of this type.
Returns:
Ordered type hierarchy of the specified type.

getInterfaceHierarchy

public static java.util.List<java.lang.Class<?>> getInterfaceHierarchy(java.lang.Class<?> type,
                                                                       java.lang.Class<?> baseType)
Returns the super interface hierarchy of a type.

Parameters:
type - Type to analyze.
baseType - Base type beyond which the hierarchy is not fetched. Each and every one of the returned types must be a sub-type of this type.
Returns:
All super interfaces of the type.
